info.title: Atlas Engine API
info.description: Atlas Engine is the execution layer behind AtlasAI. Use this API to authenticate, configure org-level settings, manage agents and tasks, connect data sources, and inspect system health. This OpenAPI file powers the interactive API reference; schemas may evolve as capabilities expand.

servers.description: Atlas API base URL (cloud or self-hosted)

atlasHost.description: Hostname of your Atlas deployment (e.g. api.atlasengine.ai, localhost:8080)

get.description:
Use this endpoint to **get** health in Atlas Engine.

Designed for load balancers and uptime probes; it is intentionally lightweight.

Authentication: **not required**.

Tip: For debugging, log the non-2xx response body (it often includes actionable error details).

Use this endpoint to **get** metrics in Atlas Engine.

Protect this endpoint in production; metrics may expose internal behavior.

Authentication: **required** (org/license headers or bearer token depending on your deployment).

Tip: For debugging, log the non-2xx response body (it often includes actionable error details).

Use this endpoint to **get** license status in Atlas Engine.

Use these endpoints to validate keys, check status, refresh entitlements, and apply updated license payloads.

Authentication: **not required**.

Tip: For debugging, log the non-2xx response body (it often includes actionable error details).

parameters.name: x-org-id
parameters.description: Organization identifier used to scope the request.

parameters.name: x-license-key
parameters.description: License key used to authorize requests for your organization.

parameters.name: org_id
parameters.description: Organization identifier used to scope the request.

parameters.name: license_key
parameters.description: License key used to authorize requests for your organization.

get.description:
Use this endpoint to **get** oauth github status in Atlas Engine.

Authentication: **not required**.

Tip: For debugging, log the non-2xx response body (it often includes actionable error details).

parameters.description: License key used to authorize requests for your organization.
